basic.description: This course develops a critical appreciation of the role of industrial relations in a global economic environment. The emphasis is on providing an understanding of the nature and scope of adjustments and adaptations in labour-management institutions and relationships required to deal with international competitive pressures, focusing on strategic links between HR/LR and competitiveness, the Japanese challenge, evolving management approaches and strategies, union responses and the labour agenda, and restructuring experience in key Canadian industries.
basic.subject: MIR
basic.title: Ir In The Global Economy

extra.enrollment_requirement: MIR Programs:  Restricted to grad students enrolled in MIR programs or approval of program director. Excl MIR 820 A&B
